moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c5 4. d5 exd5: Not the most common move but good as well.
moves.10. Qd3: A doubtfull move but I cannot exactly explain why I think so. Anyway, the queen is rather exposed and has little space available if attacked.
moves.10... a6: Black's plan is to attack on the queenside. It prepares b5.
moves.11. Bb3: To avoid the menace of b5
moves.11... b5: Now white is in trouble for black can attack wether by 12. ... c4, taking the LSB or by 12.b4, menacing the c knight. If 13. Nd1 Nxe4. Maybe white opts for 12. Nxb5 axb5 13. Qxb5 and white is only one pawn down... but white's e pawn hangs.
moves.12. Bc2: White chooses to retreat the bishop
moves.12... c4: Another candidate move was b4 but I prefered to menace the queen because the c knight is already block and I'm planning to attack e4 as soon as possible.
moves.14. Rb1: I do not see the point of this move. May be to prepare 15. b3
moves.15... Rxe5 16. f4: Obliging black to drawback but the e4 pawn loses one potential protection and, in case of a castle, the white king will be weaker
moves.17... Bxf5: White has king and queen on the same line and black has a rook in front. If white takes, black only has to attack the DSB wether by Ng4 or by Bd4 and white will be in great trouble, so that this positionnal sacrifice seemed good. Anyway, I had no proper place for the LSB
moves.18... Qe8 19. Kd2: Now white cannot castle anylonger but it protects the bishop, drives the king out of the dangerous line and joins the 2 rooks.
moves.20. fxg6: Not dangerous for black but allowing the h rok to come on f1.
moves.20... hxg6: May be 20. fxg6 would have been better (opening the f file for rook or queen) but, even with a better position, I didn't felt sure enough of myself to risk it (because of the late in material)
moves.21... b4: Now, I see a tactic which leads to a mate.
moves.22... Nxd5: menacing the DSB and, controling c3. White cannot repel both menaces
moves.23... c3+: I believe that white is doomed now.
moves.24... bxc3+: If 25. Nxc3 Nxc3 26. Kxc3 Rf5+ 27.... Rxf3 and white has lost his queen.
moves.25. Kd3: White sees the danger and moves his king to save his queen. If 25. Kd1 Nxe3+  if 25. Ke2 Rxe3+ if 25. Kc1 Nxe3
moves.26. Kc4 Qb5+:
White makes a time out. I add the mate.
if 27. Kb3 Nd3+ 28. Ka3 Qb4#
